meanings.definition: To remove moisture from the air.
meanings.sent1: I need to dehumidify the basement to prevent mold.
meanings.sent2: The dehumidifier will help dehumidify the room after a rainy day.
meanings.sent3: Trying to dehumidify a rainforest would be like trying to dry a swimming pool with a towel.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to dehumidify the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The desert sun dehumidifies the air, leaving everything parched and dry.

meanings.sent1: Running the air conditioner will dehumidify the room quickly.
meanings.sent2: The new technology can dehumidify a space in no time.
meanings.sent3: She tried to dehumidify her hair after a hot shower, but it remained frizzy.
meanings.sent4: His jokes always dehumidify a serious conversation.
meanings.sent5: The dehumidifying effect of the breeze made the summer heat more bearable.
